page.title: 12Farming.
page.content: Much of the land is given over to dairy farming.At Rodbourne Bottom Mr.Greenhill manages this dairy farm and he has 102 cows.In the winter the cows don't live in the feilds much they live in the cowsheds.Mr.Greenhill milks his cows in the morning and the evening.The time given for the milking in the morning and the evening together is 9 hours.Mr.Greenhill on average gets 1200 litres per day. The lay-pasture is for silage and winter food for the cows.The normal pasture is for grazing.The type of cows that Mr Greenhill has are friesians.They are all very good cows to milk.All the dairy farms in our area have friesian herds.
